did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Center.
did.abstract: The collection contains memoranda, papers, reports and a few photographs collected by Solomon Wollman, photographer for the University of Connecticut (1951-).

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Solomon E. Wollman, a Hartford native and graduate of Hartford schools, came to the University of Connecticut in 1951 as chief photographer after several years of professional experience.

A graduate of the Pensacola School of Photography, Wollman served for four years as a U.S. Marine Corps photographer during World War II, and later served as industrial photographer for the United Aircraft Corporation.

During his years at the University, Wollman was employed not only as University photographer but also director of the photographic laboratory. He received many awards and commendations for his work, including the first Distinguished Photographer Award (1963, 1971) of the University Photographers Association, of which he was a founding member.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains memoranda concerning student employment and items distributed to staff as well as a plan for the photographic laboratory in Storrs Hall (includes two oversize blueprints of Storrs Hall, basement floor). The folder for the Masonic Club at UConn is the only documentation of this organization to date.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into one series and arranged alphabetically by subject.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University, its history, administration, faculty, staff and students. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: Ephemeral materials pertaining to WHUS, the Faculty Center, Athletics, individuals or specific events (i.e., Armed Forces/Military Day) have been filed (as appropriate) in the University Memorabilia Collection or in the Subject files.
